meanings.definition: The act of cultivating two or more different types of cells or organisms together in the same environment for research or production purposes.
meanings.sent1: In the lab, the scientists conducted coculturing of bacteria and yeast to study their interactions.
meanings.sent2: Researchers often use coculturing to observe how different organisms behave when grown together.
meanings.sent3: The coculturing of ants and bees in the experiment created a buzzing community in the petri dish.
meanings.sent4: The coculturing of creativity and logic in the project room led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The coculturing of plants and fungi in the garden produced a harmonious ecosystem.
